intro: Atalanthus resedifolius, commonly known as the redroot sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a reddish tint, while its flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Atalanthus resedifolius is adapted to drought conditions and is considered a valuable plant for xeriscaping and wildlife habitat.
